instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message:
Hi Folks,

Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that runs slow yet passes all AHT and ASD (OS and EFI) tests.
Dirty inside but after a good cleaning no signs of corrosion. Same behavior with or without battery and other component isolation.
Figured this would be a sensor issue but no issues are found.

This was handed to me with reports of slow performance and occasional fan on max behavior (have not seen the fan on high myself).

Prior to cleaning the Mac froze when booting from a USB KG OS and restarted itself when I tried to launch an app, this behavior is gone after cleaning.
Also had the 3 RAM beeps once after assembly but reseating the RAM solved that. Battery is a compatible model A1322.

If not a sensor issue, what could cause the slowdown?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message: I have had bad experiences with generic batteries, also check pins 6 and 10 from J3100, I have found those pins loose more than once...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message: Thanks aprendiz, will check that out shortly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message: Could indeed be shit fake battery or crap under SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message: Checked the ram bay pins, they're all OK (I've only seen those come off in 2012's, is this a common issue with 2011's as well?). Tested with 2 other A1322 batteries and slow performance persists. If the SMC was at fault, wouldn't all the tests point it out?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message:
ASD does not always pick up everything. As this is a 2011 I don't think ASD checks the ME region. Was the BIOS chip ever touched?

Here is a test BIOS. Best to use a chip from a donor board and flash this file for testing. Then if this fixes it upload the original bad one to be fixed.

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1bvjP-QWHwhVCNWC7MTLl2sjEgbBdZfPs[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow
threads.message:
As far as I know, I’m the first one in here. I cleaned a few sections of the board with alcohol as they did not look 100% (dirt, no corrosion) and found that the whole upper section of the board is covered in a film of something greasy. Alcohol is repelled. It’s not visible but I can scrape it with tweezers, barely 1mm thick but I assume this stuff is under the SMC, CPU as well...

Without an ultrasonic cleaner ima have to pass on this one it looks like.

As for flashing a bios, that’s way out of my wheelhouse. I’ll get there but am not there yet :)
Thanks for sharing that though.
